oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Fourth Stanza of The Song of the Night Writers, Watkins Institute, 1968
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: “The Fourth Stanza of The Song of the Night Writers” is a publication by “The Night Writers” of Watkins Institute in 1968. The index of titles and authors consists of: Brentwood by Rosalie C. Batson -- All My Sheep All My Lambs by Mary Louise Derseweh -- The Art League, Its Growing Years by Ella Mae Harris -- A Day at Cheekwood by Maggie B. Treadway -- Harpeth Presbyterian Church by Felix H. Treadway -- Nashville is Well-Watered by Reda C. Goff -- My Favorite Soldier by Lucile McDonald -- This is Your Life, Troy Lynn by Edna Mullins -- The Streets of Nashville Can Talk by Martha Morris -- Mamma, Mamma, Here He Comes by Ruth Witt -- Paul Fitzsimmons Eve, Surgeon Extraordinary by Nona Sparks -- The Land That Was by Edna Lewis -- Nashville’s ‘Senior Citizens’ by Josephine Bamback -- A Great Teacher by Flossie L. Turner -- Christmas Panic! By Betty Casha -- Nashville by Juanita Cate -- Zachariah White, Pioneer by Mary Glenn Hearne -- The Finest Teacher I Ever Knew by William F. Kautzman -- A Day to Remember by Peggy Williams -- Transformation, A Dream by Lois Meguiar Hadley -- Evergreen Place, A House in Nashville History -- Nashville, 2000 A.D. by John Stroud. Forms part of the Betty Hadley Collection.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crabb, Alfred Leland, 1884-1979
Watkins Institute (Nashville, Tenn.)
